website_summaries.verdict: The general response towards the FuelCell Propel has been mostly positive. Those who have tested this New Balance running shoe feel that it employs a capacity for quality performance and long-lasting enjoyment. The responsive cushioning system, the wallet-friendly price, and the lightness of the build have been highlighted as the elements that elevated this product. On the other hand, the complaints center on the irritating overlay on the toe box, as well as a break-in period that is needed before achieving full comfort.Fans of neutral running shoes meant for the roads are the target market of the FuelCell Propel.
pros: Most consumers state that the sizing scheme of the New Balance FuelCell Propel follows their usual expectations
A lot of runners have welcomed the cushioning system of this running shoe
they claim that the overall feel is soft and responsive
The price is lauded for being affordable
This road running shoe has a quality that some testers believe as superb
the components apparently didn’t look or feel cheap
Many purchasers note that the lightweight construction of this product has allowed them to run for extended periods
cons: According to a few people, the overlay that’s placed on the toe box has started to irritate the toes, causing discomfort
Some runners report that the New Balance FuelCell Propel requires a break-in period because it’s initially a bit stiff

customer_reviews.title: Great grip and Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: After a week wearing them, I can recommend them and I am sure you will not regret this purchase say, Pros: * Weight, they are really light. * Sole, really wide and an amazing grip even in wet surface and gravel * Cushioning, you can feel is spongy but not too much not losing stability Cons: The toe box is a little narrow, but I feel like is stretching a little. The shoe is not as reactive as I thought it will be. Breathability, I get a little bit too hot with them but is not a major problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel González González

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but check the sizing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a UK9 which is what i normally wear in Asics trainers. In Asics a UK9 is 44 european and 28cm but in New Balance they come in as 43 european and 27.5cm. I reordered in 9.5 but these came up a bit loose (didnt feel like my heel was being held in securely. Otherwise very comfortable trainer. No issue with the return to Amazon and a swift refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. Newlands

customer_reviews.title: Love New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new balance gear. Have several pairs of trainers. These fit nice, recommend going up half a size, very springy and supportive. Neutral arch support which is good for me. Funky design would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gavino Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: Paid nearly eighty pounds for New Balance Fuelcell propel shoes. I received them in May and since then have not used them for five weeks as i was injured. They have worn out at the front end making them virtually useless. I feel very let down by these expensive waste of money running shoes. Do not buy them, they do not last
customer_reviews.author: martin wallis

customer_reviews.title: Good for 12k & under
customer_reviews.text: My go to shoe for fast, 12k & below runs .. cornering in the wet wearing these is my only gripe ..
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. P. Stamp

customer_reviews.title: Very small fitting
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally an 8.5. Purchased these in a 9 to be safe due to reviews saying they are small fitting. 9 was too small. Buy at least a size over what you usually take I'd say
customer_reviews.author: colm brady

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 11, but these fit at 11.5. they're comfortable and cushioned, good for running.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and cushioned
customer_reviews.text: Feels very lightweight, foot is cushioned but still feels like the shoe propels you along. I’ve only done one 10km run so I can’t test the longevity but feels nice and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this shoes about 1 month and i love than, they is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Juchneski

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for a few weeks and I keep getting sore feet and legs, not good for long runs 👎.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe C.

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's FuelCell Propel Running Shoes
feature_bullets: Breathable Mesh- Increases cool air flow for regulated temperature.
Trace Fibre- Through the midfoot to rearfoot provides a secure, locked-down fit and midfoot support.
Bootie Construction- Sleek fit and distinctive aesthetic.
Lacing System - Ensures a locked-down fit.
